caption.p: Parvovirus infections in the lung are similar to those shown in other organs. This illustration shows the bone marrow of an immunocompromised patient. Note eosinophilic inclusions within early erythroid forms. Hematoxylin and eosin (Courtesy of Dr. Richard L. Kradin, Massachusetts General Hospital, with permission from Diagnostic Pathology of Infectious Disease, 2010, Saunders-Elsevier, Publishers)
